text: Which of the following frequencies is within the General class portion of the 15-meter band?
Which of the following transmissions is permitted for all amateur stations?
choices: Unidentified transmissions of less than 10 seconds duration for test purposes only
Automatic retransmission of other amateur signals by any amateur station
Occasional retransmission of weather and propagation forecast information from US government stations
Encrypted messages, if not intended to facilitate a criminal act

text: What is the limit for transmitter power on the 1.8 MHz band?
choices: 200 watts PEP output
1000 watts PEP output
1200 watts PEP output
1500 watts PEP output

text: When operating a US station by remote control from outside the country, what license is required of the control operator?
choices: A US operator/primary station license
Only an appropriate US operator/primary license and a special remote station permit from the FCC
Only a license from the foreign country, as long as the call sign includes identification of portable operation in the US
A license from the foreign country and a special remote station permit from the FCC

text: When may a 10-meter repeater retransmit the 2-meter signal from a station that has a Technician class control operator?
choices: Under no circumstances
Only if the station on 10-meters is operating under a Special Temporary Authorization allowing such retransmission
Only during an FCC-declared general state of communications emergency
Only if the 10-meter repeater control operator holds at least a General class license

text: Which of the following statements is true of single sideband (SSB)?
choices: Only one sideband and the carrier are transmitted; the other sideband is suppressed
Only one sideband is transmitted; the other sideband and carrier are suppressed
SSB is the only voice mode authorized on the 20-, 15-, and 10-meter amateur bands
SSB is the only voice mode authorized on the 160-, 75-, and 40-meter amateur bands

text: What is the first thing you should do if you are communicating with another amateur station and hear a station in distress break in?
choices: Inform your local emergency coordinator
Acknowledge the station in distress and determine what assistance may be needed
Immediately decrease power to avoid interfering with the station in distress
Immediately cease all transmissions

text: What does the Q signal ΓÇ£QSLΓÇ¥ mean?
choices: Send slower
We have already confirmed the contact
I have received and understood
We have worked before

text: Which of the following are objectives of the Volunteer Monitor Program?
choices: To conduct efficient and orderly amateur licensing examinations
To provide emergency and public safety communications
To coordinate repeaters for efficient and orderly spectrum usage
To encourage amateur radio operators to self-regulate and comply with the rules

text: Which of the following describes Winlink?
choices: An amateur radio wireless network to send and receive email on the internet
A form of Packet Radio
A wireless network capable of both VHF and HF band operation
All of the above

text: Which of the following are the least reliable bands for long-distance communications during periods of low solar activity?
choices: 80 meters and 160 meters
60 meters and 40 meters
30 meters and 20 meters
15 meters, 12 meters, and 10 meters

text: How does the ionosphere affect radio waves with frequencies below the MUF and above the LUF?
choices: They are refracted back to Earth
They pass through the ionosphere
They are amplified by interaction with the ionosphere
They are refracted and trapped in the ionosphere to circle Earth

text: What does the term ΓÇ£critical angleΓÇ¥ mean, as applied to radio wave propagation?
choices: The long path azimuth of a distant station
The short path azimuth of a distant station
The lowest takeoff angle that will return a radio wave to Earth under specific ionospheric conditions
The highest takeoff angle that will return a radio wave to Earth under specific ionospheric conditions

text: What is the purpose of using a receive attenuator?
choices: To prevent receiver overload from strong incoming signals
To reduce the transmitter power when driving a linear amplifier
To reduce power consumption when operating from batteries
To reduce excessive audio level on strong signals

text: Which of the following can be measured with an antenna analyzer?
choices: Front-to-back ratio of an antenna
Power output from a transmitter
Impedance of coaxial cable
Gain of a directional antenna

text: What is a possible cause of high voltages that produce RF burns?
choices: Flat braid rather than round wire has been used for the ground wire
Insulated wire has been used for the ground wire
The ground rod is resonant
The ground wire has high impedance on that frequency

text: What is the effect of an incorrectly adjusted speech processor?
choices: Distorted speech
Excess intermodulation products
Excessive background noise
All these choices are correct

text: What is the purpose of a corona ball on an HF mobile antenna?
choices: To narrow the operating bandwidth of the antenna
To increase the ΓÇ£QΓÇ¥ of the antenna
To reduce the chance of damage if the antenna should strike an object
To reduce RF voltage discharge from the tip of the antenna while transmitting

text: What letter is used to represent reactance?
choices: Z
X
B
Y

text: What is the output PEP of 500 volts peak-to-peak across a 50-ohm load?
choices: 8.75 watts
625 watts
2500 watts
5000 watts

text: Which of the following components should be added to an inductor to increase the inductance?
choices: A capacitor in series
A capacitor in parallel
An inductor in parallel
An inductor in series

text: Which of the following describes MOSFET construction?
choices: The gate is formed by a back-biased junction
The gate is separated from the channel by a thin insulating layer
The source is separated from the drain by a thin insulating layer
The source is formed by depositing metal on silicon

text: What determines the performance of a ferrite core at different frequencies?
choices: Its conductivity
Its thickness
The composition, or ΓÇ£mix,ΓÇ¥ of materials used
The ratio of outer diameter to inner diameter

text: What portion of the AC cycle is converted to DC by a full-wave rectifier?
choices: 90 degrees
180 degrees
270 degrees
360 degrees

text: Which of the following are basic components of a sine wave oscillator?
choices: An amplifier and a divider
A frequency multiplier and a mixer
A circulator and a filter operating in a feed-forward loop
A filter and an amplifier operating in a feedback loop

text: How is a product detector used?
choices: Used in test gear to detect spurious mixing products
Used in transmitter to perform frequency multiplication
Used in an FM receiver to filter out unwanted sidebands
Used in a single sideband receiver to extract the modulated signal

text: What is the modulation envelope of an AM signal?
choices: The waveform created by connecting the peak values of the modulated signal
The carrier frequency that contains the signal
Spurious signals that envelop nearby frequencies
The bandwidth of the modulated signal

text: Which mixer input is varied or tuned to convert signals of different frequencies to an intermediate frequency (IF)?
choices: Image frequency
Local oscillator
RF input
Beat frequency oscillator

text: Which of the following describes a waterfall display?
choices: Frequency is horizontal, signal strength is vertical, time is intensity
Frequency is vertical, signal strength is intensity, time is horizontal
Frequency is horizontal, signal strength is intensity, time is vertical
Frequency is vertical, signal strength is horizontal, time is intensity

text: What is the effect of transmission line loss on SWR measured at the input to the line?
choices: Higher loss reduces SWR measured at the input to the line
Higher loss increases SWR measured at the input to the line
Higher loss increases the accuracy of SWR measured at the input to the line
Transmission line loss does not affect the SWR measurement

text: What is the approximate length for a 1/4 wave monopole antenna cut for 28.5 MHz?
choices: 8 feet
11 feet
16 feet
21 feet

text: What is a beta or hairpin match?
choices: A shorted transmission line stub placed at the feed point of a Yagi antenna to provide impedance matching
A 1/4 wavelength section of 75-ohm coax in series with the feed point of a Yagi to provide impedance matching
A series capacitor selected to cancel the inductive reactance of a folded dipole antenna
A section of 300-ohm twin-lead transmission line used to match a folded dipole antenna

text: What is the common name of a dipole with a single central support?
choices: Inverted V
Inverted L
Sloper
Lazy H

text: Which of the following steps must an amateur operator take to ensure compliance with RF safety regulations?
choices: Post a copy of FCC Part 97.13 in the station
Notify neighbors within a 100-foot radius of the antenna of the existence of the station and power levels
Perform a routine RF exposure evaluation and prevent access to any identified high exposure areas
All these choices are correct

text: Which of the following conditions will cause a ground fault circuit interrupter (GFCI) to disconnect AC power?
choices: Current flowing from one or more of the hot wires to the neutral wire
Current flowing from one or more of the hot wires directly to ground
Overvoltage on the hot wires
All these choices are correct
